title: United Coloured People's Association: Black Power in Britain
description: The introductory pamphlet of the United Coloured People's Association (UCPA) entitled 'Black Power in Britain: A Special Statement', confiscated by the Metropolitan Police and subsequently held within the National Archives: MEPO 2/11409
creator: United Coloured People's Association
subject: black power
source: Benedict Obi EGBUNA, Peter MARTIN and Gideon Turagalevu DOLO: charged with circulating writings at Speakers' Corner, Hyde Park, threatening to kill and maim police officers, involvement of the above-named with 'Black Panther' Party, 1968-69, The National Archives, Kew, MEPO 2/11409

title: Grassroots Storefront
description: Headquarters of the Black Liberation Front (BLF) at  61 Golborne Road, London, W10, by 1986 this had moved to 71 Golborne Road.
creator: Black Liberation Front
subject: black power

title: Racial Adjustment Action Society Pamphlet
description: Front cover of the first pamphlet of the Racial Adjustment Action Society (RAAS) pamphlet, established by Michael X (then Abdul Malilk) in 1965.
creator: Racial Adjustment Action Society
subject: black power
source: The 'Black House', headquarters of the Racial Adjustment Awareness Society, at 95-101 Holloway Road, N7: damage caused by fire on 15 January 1970. Unsubstantiated allegations made by Malik, MA, alias Michael X, against the police and fire brigade. With plan and photographs. The Natinal Archives, Kew, MEPO 28/4
